sections.title: Summary
sections.value: Motivated Software Developer seeking opportunity to architect new software applications.

sections.title: Skills
items: Specialities in back-end authentication and authorization
Server Side (Node.js, PHP, ASP.Net, Ruby on Rails)
Database (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
DevOps Cloud Services (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)
Worked with development teams and product owner to build software solutions.
Developed and delivered scalable web applications in a continuous deployment environment.
Iteratively constructed applications in a test-driven environment, following DevOps best practices.
Handled a complex back-end environment, and created an accessible, clean and interactive user experience
Worked as part of an Agile team in a creative work-space where multi-disciplinary teams of public servants and private sector consultants can learn
Explored new technical aspects to improve the existing system and reduce technical debt
Developed new, efficient, and well-tested code for variety of different projects.
Performed server code optimization using benchmark scripts.
Initiated efforts to migrate legacy applications to modern application platform. (DB Migration, PHP version, Source Control; SVN to Git)
Coordinated with QA testers for end-to-end unit testing and post-production testing.
Modified existing legacy codebase to enhance performance and add new features.
Provided web solutions for small business owners.
Managed road map for system architecture, product design and development.
Developed a desktop application using C#.Net Windows Windows Forms.

sections.title: Accomplishment

items.title: Battlesnake Intermediate division 3rd Prize, 2019
items: 3rd place out of 65 teams in intermediate division

items.title: The Governor General’s Collegiate Bronze Medal, 2018
items.value: “Presented each year to recognize the exceptional academic accomplishments of a student who achieves the highest overall grade point average (GPA) from a diploma-level post-secondary college program.”

items.title: Earned Technology Award of Excellence, 2017
items.value: “Awarded to a graduating student from a technology program who has demonstrated academic excellence and whose accomplishments outside of class exemplify Camosun College’s commitment to excellence in learning.”

items: The Dean's letter for the outstanding academic achievement (Q1~Q6)

items.title: Covault Brochure Application

Challenges: To transform XML feed and cache the transformed data to serve frontend
Tools: Visual Studio Code, Github, Heroku, AWS

Challenges: To understand the old & new technologies to apply changes within a minimum impact
Tools: Visual Studio Code, Docker, GitLab, Nexus

items.title: Udutu; Cloud Based LMS for Business

Challenges: To run Windows on Mac; identify only necessary binaries from each bin directory
